lines.text: Nice wedding. You know, Jack, next week, I'd like you to swing by the office. I have some new tests I'd like to run on you...
Jack, I think we should try dating. Maybe not exclusively at first, at least for me, but...
Jack, since you're not going on the cruise, I sure could use you at the store on Monday

[realization dawns on him]
That was the Cowboy.
[runs away]
Who's the Cowboy?
It's um... classified.

[stops and turns around - to Doctor Greenbush]
Doc, I'm cured!

[to Wendy]
Wendy, not a chance!

[to Mr. Wormwood]
And Mr. Wormwood, thank you! And I quit.
[runs and jumps into Tuck's car]
We're gonna drink this one to Ozzie. A good man who tried to save my ass by injecting me into yours.
[Jack hears Tuck talking to him in the doctor's office]
Did you hear that?
Hear what?
You didn't hear that then?
Noooo, I'm sorry, I didn't hear anything. Are you feeling all right?
Would I *BE* in a *DOCTOR'S OFFICE* if I *WAS* feeling all right?

[instructing him to get his jacket/car keys out of his locker]
See that door?
Yeah.
Use it.
[Jack turns away from it]
Well what are you waiting for?
Look, don't rush me, okay? Just... just be quiet for a second, let me think this through.

Jack, excuse me, but I want you to factor this into your thinking, alright? You heard the man! My air supply's running out! If you don't help me, you're going to wind up with this miniaturized submersible pod floating around your insides with this teeny tiny human skeleton at the helm.

[very disgusted]
... ugh.
Not a pretty thought!
I'm right here, INSIDE you INSIDE YOUR BODY!

[stands up]
Oh God! Somebody help me! I'M POSSESSED!
Uh, good news Jack! I think we can rule out demonic possession right off the bat.
But, the little voice from inside was talking to me.
demons talk THROUGH you - not TO you.

[Regarding the "theistic hysteria" Jack seems to be suffering from]
H-how do you treat that?
Well the medieval remedy was to flay the skin off your body with brands of fire. I have no idea what the current technique is.
[pickup line]
Women love me. But you know that.
[Into a mirror]
zero defects.
When things are at their darkest, pal, it's a brave man that can kick back and party.

[Getting nauseated by the sight of Igoe's skeleton]
Jack... it worked. You just digested the bad guy.
[Jack burps]
You've got a great future in front of you in Retail Food marketing, and I just hate to see you throw it all away by going psycho on us.
In lieu of champagne, how about some real pain? Propane?
Nuclear weapons, Jack. They mean nothing. Everybody's got 'em, nobody has the balls to use 'em. Am I right?
[Jack shrugs, then tries to say something]
Space, you say? Space is a flop. Didn't you know that?
[Jack shakes his head]

An endless junkyard of orbiting debris. Ah, but! - miniaturization, Jack. That's the ticket. That's the edge everybody's been looking for. Who will have that edge Jack? What country... will control miniaturization?
[takes a puff of his cigar]
Frankly, I don't give a shit. I'm only in this for the money. And that's why, Jack, we've got to get that little pod out
[prods Jack's side]
from inside of you!
[laughs maniacally around his cigar]
[Scrimshaw, shrunk down to half his normal size, is grappling with Jack inside a speeding car]
You insignificant little pipsqueak, I'm in charge here!

[after Tuck shorted out the TV in Jack's apartment to get his attention, setting it on fire]
Oh, Jack.
[Jack jumps at the sound of his voice, accidentally setting off the fire extinguisher in his hands]
You do see that I am real. You do believe me now, don't you? Huh?

[weary]
I... I don't know what to believe.
Believe it, Jack. Believe it because it's true. Now I want you to listen to me and I want you to listen good. Because we're in this together. And we've gotta' help each other out. Alright?
Yes.
Right. You don't work at the lab, do you?
Lab? No, I work at Safeway.
And you don't know anything about the experiment?
What experiment?

[to himself]
Oh, God. The miniaturisation experiment.
No.
Alright. Jack, my name is Lt. Tuck Pendleton. I've been miniaturised. I was supposed to be injected into the body of a laboratory rabbit and somehow I got inside you instead.
What do you mean somehow? How?
All I know is I was inside a syringe, and now I'm inside you.

[to himself, thinking back to his encounter with Ozzie at the mall]
Syringe.
Of course, the most fun I've ever had is tryin' to land a crippled F-14 with a stubborn nose gear on the deck of a rolling flat-top in zero visibility...
And give that 'crippled Tomcat' story a rest. We've all heard it!
Oh, gosh, Rusty, you're right. 'Course, when MY moment of glory came, I didn't take a dump down the leg of MY flight suit!
[reading from computer, how to enlarge a person]
Eat me, drink me? What is that? From The Exorcist? No, Alice in Wonderland! Alice she drank something to be big and ate something to be small.
I'm possessed!
We've got the chip!
All right!
We're on the way to the lab!
All right!
But I think they put someone in there with you!
All... what?
Jack Putter to the rescue!
[Margaret prepares to inject a miniaturized Igoe into Jack]
Now, wait a minute. What happens once Igoe's taken control of their pod?
Mr. Igoe will pilot the pod out through a tear duct or a sweat gland.
Why chance that? Once he's gotten control of the pod and takes the chip, let's re-enlarge.
While it's still inside Mr. Putter?
Why not?
Have you any idea what kind of mess that would make?

[Jack is talking while urinating in a urinal]
Play with it, pal. Don't talk to it.

[seeing the cowboy lighting up his cigar]
I'm sorry sir, but you're gonna have to extinguish that cigar.

[extinguishes his cigar in his hand and sniffs his hand]
Mmmmmm. There's nothing like a good cigar. Eh? Partner?
[puts his cigar in the man's suit pocket]
Listen sweetie, I don't carry that kind of cash around with me.
[while fighting Mr. Igoe]
[shouting]
Make a pull on this Pal!

[about to dump Mr. Igoe into Jack's stomach]
Ok pal. Here's how I spell relief.

[trapped in the miniaturizer with Canker]
We're in here!
Who's in there?
The green button!
Dr. Canker?

[to the henchman]
Press the green button, you fool!
He'll never find it!
The man's a high school graduate! The green button, you fool!
Come in here you Safeway clerk!
Putter, don't be a Putz! Get in here!
[Jack and Lydia encounter a henchman in the stairwell; Lydia aims a gun at him]
Hold it!
You hold it!
I bet it ain't even loaded!
Oh yeah?
[she aims the gun at the ceiling and fires; it clicks emptily]
Oh no, she knows about the suitcase?
What exactly are we doing here?
We're waiting for someone.
oh, who are we we waiting for?
The Cowboy. I've been tracking his movements for months and he got to the airport about an hour ago and he always stays here.
[points to the hotel]
I have a feeling he's gonna lead us right to that chip we need.
Why do you think that?
[looking at her legs]

[noticing Jack is ogling Lydia]
Hey, knock it off!
'Cause he's a fence. He deals in stolen technology, Western technology almost exclusively, which he then sells overseas to the highest bidder. Who do you think introduced Velcro to the Persian Gulf?
Really?

[nodding]
Mm hmm.
00 a.m. I got drunk and threw up, and fell down a manhole walking you home.
[Lydia herds Scrimshaw and his thugs into the miniaturizer at gunpoint, while Jack is fiddling with the control panel]
Don't worry, they won't know how to close it.
[the door closes over them]
Certainly not. I'll get you for this, Margaret.
I read the note. It's your standard farewell address. I know it by heart.
Excuse me.

Lydia. Look, don't leave. You know you love me, huh? Look, I know you're crazy about me. I mean, in a week or two I'm going to call you, you're going to call me, and we're going to be back together again.
No, we won't.
I don't get it. I get a little drunk, I make an ass out of myself... What's the big deal?
Things are different now, Tuck. It just hurts me too much to be with you.
